title: The Power of the Unexpected Event: Dr. Paula Boddington on Personhood, Survivor Guilt & Transparency
description:
Dr. Paula Boddington, educator, researcher and philosopher of AI, Data Ethics tells the story of her life, the impact of a family focused on the benefits of education and specifically, a father who taught her how to make things with her hands and the importance of tools and how to use them.

Paula experienced a traumatic event, the massacre that took 35 lives in Port Arthur, Tasmania on April 28, 1996, and she tells how that event changed her perspective.

We discussed Personhood, Survivor Guilt and the impact of each individual life.
